alert.note: Alert for Edwards; Ford; Gray; Hodgeman; Pawnee; Stafford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 11:33PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Ford, southeastern Hodgeman, Pawnee, northern Stafford, northeastern Gray and northwestern Edwards Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1132 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pawnee Rock to 8 miles north of Cimarron. Movement was east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Larned around 1140 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Radium. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central and southwestern Kansas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for south central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Edwards; Ford; Gray; Hodgeman; Pawnee; Stafford
